Example Sentence: I will be there to support you, come rain or shine.
After losing the championship game, the coach reminded his team, "Don't cry over spilled milk. We may have lost this game, but we can learn from our mistakes and come back stronger next season."
The party started off small and quiet, but once more people arrived, things quickly got out of hand with loud music, dancing on tables, and drinks being spilled everywhere.

Idiom: Take the bull by the horns
Example Sentence: When faced with a difficult deadline, instead of avoiding it, it's better to take the bull by the horns and tackle the task head-on.

Idiom: A leopard can't change its spots
Example Sentence: Despite his promises to change, John showed once again that a leopard can't change its spots when he was caught lying to his boss.
The new employee stole my thunder by presenting my project ideas before I had a chance to share them with the team.
